understands a little bit about how this particular region in northern california

this wasn't always the case with Silicon Valley in many ways the region has evolved over the years
you know today Silicon Valley is known for creating working-class millionaires
what some journalists have dubbed the silicon Aires for you know having
distributed wealth from the work that they've done in the area but this is
something that actually really began at the start of or the mid 20th century you
know this was established with companies such as Fairchild Semiconductor Varian
associates HP and the original premise was that management wanted to reward and
motivate the implant employees particularly the engineers and the scientists who had a direct impact on
building the products and what management found is that this practice
was effective incentive really excited and energized the employees gave them a
reason to feel that they were part of a broader mandate and mission and over the
years this practice evolved to allow the line workers those who were a part of
the company but may not have direct role in a new product development to also become joint owners in that particular
company and so through the 1960s up to
today and management you know gradually rewarded all employees and now employee
ownership has become a common practice that really defines Silicon Valley unlike a lot of other regions around the

ownership also influences organizational culture so the way that equity might be
structured has a way on going to beliefs and values that employee might hold in
particular employees and workers end up feeling much more empowered they gain
more input about the decisions that they make about their work the hierarchy is
flattened and in many cases and when people think about new companies and startups in Silicon Valley they often

shows that this is a recent growth so back in the 1990's the state-owned

either owns completely or partially by the workers themselves and this started to generate a lot of interest in stock

China you know what should you consider very simply the first option is that
